translation: Speech of Kansa address to his servants:

gurmukhi: bwq sunI jb nwrd kI ieh qo niRp qo niRp ky mn mwih BeI hY ]mwrhu jwie iesY Ab hI kir BiRqn nYn kI sYn deI hY ]
transliteration: Baat Sounijab Naarad Kieh To Nrip Ke Man Maah(i) Bhaihai|| Darob Jaae Isai Ab Hikar(i) Bhritan Nain Kisain Daihai||
translation: When the king listened to the speech of Narada, it went deeper into his mind; he told his servants with signs to kill the infant immediately;

gurmukhi: daur gey iqh Awies mwn kY bwq iehY cl log geI hY ]pwQr pY hin kY Gin ijau pun jIvih qy kir iBMn leI hY ]49]
transliteration: Daur Gad Tih Aais Maan Kai Baat Ihai Chal Log Gadhai|| Paathar Pai Han(i) Kai Ghan(i) Jio Poun Jeevah(i) Te Kar(i) Bhinn Laee||49||
translation: Receiving his order all (the servants) ran away and they dashed the baby against a store like a hammer, separated the soul from the body.49.

gurmukhi: Aaur BXo suq jo iqhky giH qau niRp kMs mhw miq hIno ]syvk Byj dey iqn lXwie kY pwQr pY hin kY puin dIno ]
transliteration: Aur Bhayo Sout Jo Tihke Grah(i) Tau Nrip Kans Mahaa Mat(i) Bino|| Sewak Bhej Dae Tin Lyaae Kai Paathar Pai Han(i) Kai Poun(i)||
translation: Another son who was born to Devaki and Vasudev, who was also killed on the orders of Kans of vicious intellenct, by his servants by dashing him on the store; the dead body was given back to the parents;

gurmukhi: Sor prXo sBhI pur mY kib nY iqhko js ieau lK lIno ]ieMdR mUE suinkY rn mY iml kY sr mMfl rodn kIno ]50]
transliteration: Shor Daryo Sabh-hipur Mai Kabi Nai Tihko Jas To Lakh Leeno|| Indra Moond Soun(i)kai Ran Mai Mil Kai Sar Mandal Rodan Keeno||50||
translation: Hearing about this heinous crime, there was great uproar in the whole city and this tumult appeared to the poet like the cries of gods on the death of Indra.50.

gurmukhi: Aaur BXo suq jo iqh ky gH nwm DrXo iqh ko iqn hUMjY ]mwr dXo suinkY niRp kMs su pwQr pY hin fwirE KUMjY ]
transliteration: Aur Bhayo Sout Jo Tih Ke Grah Naam Ddaryo Tih Ko Tin Hoonjai|| Maar Dayo Soun(i)kai Nrip Kans Su Paathar Pai Han(i) Daario Khoonjai||
translation: Another son was born in their house who was named Jaya, but he was also dashed against the stone by the king Kansa;

gurmukhi: sIs ky bwr auKwrq dyvkI rodn corn qyN Gir gUMjY ]ijau ruq AMq bsMq smY niB kO ijm jwq pukwrq kUMjY ]51]
transliteration: Sis Ke Baar Oukhaarat Devakirodan Choran Ten Ghar(i) Goonjai|| Jio Rout Ant Basant Samai Nabh(i) Kau Jim Jaat Poukaarat Koonjai||51||
translation: Devaki began to pull out the hair of her head and began to cry like the bird called Karauncha in the sky in the spring season.51.

gurmukhi: cauQo puqR BXo so BI kMs mwr dXo iqh Sok bVvw kI lwtYN mn mYN jgq hY ]
transliteration: Chaoutho Poutra Bhayo So Bhikans Maar Dayo Tih Shok Badvaa Kilaatain Man Main Jagad Hai||
translation: The fourth son was born and he was also killed by Kansa; the flames of sorrow blazed in the hearts of Devaki and Vasudev;

gurmukhi: prI hYgI dwsI mhw mh hU kI PwsI bIc geI imt soBw pY audwsI hI pgq hY ]
transliteration: Parihaigidaasimahaa Hoo Kiphaasibeech Gadmit Sobhaa Pai Udaasihipagad Hai||
translation: All the beauty of Devaki was finished by the noose of great attachment around her neck and she was drowned in great anguish;

gurmukhi: kYDO qum nwQ hY qum hÍY snwQ hm hUM pY hUMjY pq kI n giq AOr qn kI n gq hY ]
transliteration: Kaidhau Toum Naath Hai Toum Hvai Sanaath Ham Hoon Pai Hoonjai Pat Kina Gad(i) Aur Tan Kina Gad Hai||
translation: She says, “O my God ! what type of Lord Thou art and what type of protected people we are? We have neither received any honour nor have got any physical protection;
